content.question: A horizontal disk is at rest on top of an axle, and the friction between the disk and axle is not negligible. In experiment 1, an applied torque is exerted to the edge of the disk for <math alttext="2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></math>. At that moment, the applied torque is removed, and the disk eventually comes to rest as a result of a frictional torque. Graphs of the disk’s angular momentum as a function of time are shown in Figures 1 and 2 for the two experiments. Which of the following statements is correct about the applied torque <math alttext="t sub applied" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> and frictional torque <math alttext="t sub friction" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>c</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math>exerted on the disk in experiment 1 and experiment 2 ?
